item.title: 5 zodiac signs that will get rich in 2025, as per Baba Vanga's predictions - The Times of India
item.description:
5 Zodiac Signs That Will Get Rich in 2025 According to Baba Vanga's Predictions

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Unknown

Baba Vanga, the famous Bulgarian mystic known for her accurate predictions, has foretold that five specific zodiac signs will experience significant financial success in 2025. This article explores who Baba Vanga is and highlights the zodiac signs that will supposedly thrive financially in the coming year.

Key Points:

  • Baba Vanga is a revered figure known for her prophecies regarding the future.
  • Her predictions for 2025 include financial prosperity for people born under five particular zodiac signs.
  • The article encourages readers to find out if their zodiac sign is among those predicted to become wealthy.
“Many people believe her prophecies even today, many years after her death.”

The article captures the intrigue surrounding Baba Vanga and her predictions, inviting readers to consider their fortunes for the year ahead.

Viral Moment: Elon Musk and Donald Trump Dance Together at New Year's Party

Date & Source: January 1, 2023, Times of India

An unexpected viral moment occurred at a New Year's party where Elon Musk and Donald Trump were caught on camera dancing together. The video has since gone viral on social media.

  • The video shows Musk and Trump, dressed casually, dancing together at a party.
  • The clip has sparked reactions and discussions online, with many expressing surprise and amusement.
  • Neither Musk nor Trump have commented on the video yet.

Conclusion: The video of Elon Musk and Donald Trump dancing together has become a popular topic of discussion online, adding an unexpected twist to their public personas.

item.title: 10 killed, several injured as truck rams into crowd in New Orleans; ‘terrorist attack,’ says mayor - The Indian Express
item.description:
10 killed, 30 injured as truck rams into crowd in New Orleans; ‘terrorist attack,’ says mayor

Date: Wednesday, Source: BBC, CBS News

At least 10 people were killed and 30 more injured after a truck drove into a crowd on Bourbon Street in New Orleans. The driver exited the vehicle and began firing a weapon before police returned fire.

  • The truck crashed into a crowd at high speed during New Year’s celebrations.
  • New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell described the incident as a “terrorist attack.”
  • Witnesses reported the driver firing a weapon after the crash.
  • Injured individuals were taken to five local hospitals.
  • The incident occurred shortly before the AllState Bowl college football game.
  • Historical context: Similar events have occurred in New Orleans, including previous shootings and vehicle attacks.
“There has been a mass casualty incident on Canal and Bourbon Street. Get yourself away from the area.” - Nola Ready

This tragic incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding safety during large public events in urban areas.

item.title: New Orleans terror attack: 10 dead, over 30 injured after vehicle rams into crowd, FBI finds explosive device - India TV News
item.description:
New Orleans Terror Attack: 10 Dead and Over 30 Injured After Vehicle Rams Into Crowd

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: India TV News

At least ten people were killed and 30 injured after a car rammed into people celebrating the new year in New Orleans, a southern US city. Police officials reported that a vehicle ploughed into a crowd on Bourbon Street in the city's French Quarter.

  • The attack was deemed intentional, with the suspect firing at security officials.
  • New Orleans Mayor LaToya Cantrell labeled the incident as a “terrorist attack”.
  • Bourbon Street was crowded with New Year’s celebrants at the time.
  • The FBI discovered an explosive device at the scene.
“This is a terrorist attack,” said Mayor LaToya Cantrell.

This tragic incident marred the New Year’s celebrations in New Orleans and raises urgent concerns about public safety.

item.title: Russia ceases gas transit through Ukraine after over 30 years - The Times of India
item.description:
Russia Ceases Gas Transit Through Ukraine

Date & Source: June 20, 2023, from Times of India

After over three decades, Russia has stopped gas transit through Ukraine. This decision, effective from June 20, 2023, comes amidst political tensions and Russia's increasing use of the Nord Stream 1 pipeline.

  • Russia cites maintenance work on the Nord Stream 1 pipeline as the reason for the halt.
  • The move could disrupt European gas supplies, as Ukraine is a major transit route for Russian gas to Europe.
  • The Ukrainian and European gas markets have been preparing for such a scenario.

Ukraine's state-owned energy company, Naftogaz, has already started preparations to cover gas supplies to customers, including using underground gas storage facilities.

Source: Times of India

item.title: As it happened | New Year 2025 Celebrations: New York City welcomes 2025 with Ball Drop moment - WION
item.description:
World Welcomes 2025: Global New Year Celebrations

Published on January 1, 2025 - Source: The Public Live

The New Year's celebrations took place across the world as people enthusiastically marked the arrival of 2025. From small islands in the Pacific to energetic and busy cities, all welcomed the New Year with passion and thrill.

  1. New York City welcomed 2025 with the iconic 'Ball Drop' tradition at Times Square.
  2. The Rio Mayor's Press Office considers the New Year's Eve celebration in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, the world's biggest, with 2 million people expected to attend.
  3. The first ball drop in New York happened on December 31, 1907, and has been held every year since, except for 1942 and 1943 due to wartime blackouts.
  4. New Year celebrations around the world kicked off with fireworks and other festivities, including in Sydney, Australia, and New Zealand.
  5. Some countries held muted New Year events, such as South Korea, following recent tragic events.

New York City’s iconic Times Square was electric last night as the clock struck midnight, ringing in the year 2025 with an unforgettable celebration. Crowds gathered, bundled up and buzzing with excitement, to witness the historic ball drop, one of the most anticipated moments in… pic.twitter.com/GTAqYy619Y

— NYC Scoop (@NY_Scoop) January 1, 2025

item.title: Watch: Elon Musk celebrates New Year's bash with Trump, grooves to music alongside son X - The Times of India
item.description:
Watch: Elon Musk celebrates New Year's bash with Trump, grooves to music alongside son X

"It's a moment to celebrate the new beginnings as we enter 2024!" - Elon Musk

This New Year's celebration signifies a high-profile gathering that reflects the ongoing connections between prominent figures in business and politics.

item.title: 'We need smart people in our country': Trump says he hasn't changed his mind on H1B visas - The Times of India
item.description:
'We need smart people in our country': Trump says he hasn't changed his mind on H1B visas

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The article discusses former President Donald Trump’s stance on H1B visas, reiterating his belief in the necessity of skilled immigrants for the U.S. economy.

  • Trump emphasizes the importance of attracting talented individuals.
  • He expresses no change in his previous opposition to the current immigration policies regarding H1B visas.
  • Concerns are raised about the impact of immigration regulations on U.S. tech industries.
“We need smart people in our country.”

In conclusion, Trump’s comments highlight ongoing debates around immigration and its role in the U.S. workforce.

item.title: As ‘Notorious’ Iranian Shahed Kamikaze UAVs Haunt Ukraine, Kyiv Tests German-Built Interceptor Drone To Counter Them - EurAsian Times
item.description:
Ukraine Tests German Interceptor Drone Against Iranian Shahed UAVs

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Brave1

Ukraine successfully tested a German-built interceptor drone aimed at countering reconnaissance UAVs, including the Iranian-designed Shahed drones, as confirmed by Brave1, a defense-tech platform.

  • The drone achieved speeds up to 300 km/h and a range of 20 km.
  • It will feature an automatic targeting system based on machine vision.
  • Ukrainian Defense Forces commended its effective performance during tests.
  • The testing follows a trend of international partnerships enhancing Ukraine's defense capabilities.
  • In November, American drones were also tested as part of efforts to combat UAV threats.
  • The Iranian-designed Shahed drones have caused significant damage to Ukraine’s infrastructure.
“We continue to work towards building partnerships with international developers whose solutions and technologies can help Ukraine win this war,” Brave1 stated.

This interceptor initiative seeks more cost-effective methods to counter drone threats amidst ongoing warfare in Ukraine.

item.title: Watch: China rings in New Year with incredible drone show - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Watch: China rings in New Year with incredible drone show

Date: 01 January 2025, Source: IST

China celebrated New Year's Eve with an impressive drone show featuring over 10,000 drones lighting up the sky. President Xi Jinping addressed the nation, acknowledging economic challenges while urging confidence in a brighter future.

  • The drone show included stunning visuals, with a dragon gliding through the air.
  • Xi Jinping recognized the difficulties facing the economy and pledged governmental efforts for growth.
  • In his speech, Xi reaffirmed Taiwan's status as part of China.
  • Other global cities, such as Auckland and Sydney, also celebrated with fireworks and light displays.
“The current economic operation is facing some new situations, there are challenges from the uncertainty of the external environment...” - Xi Jinping

China's display sets a vibrant tone for the New Year, showcasing technological innovation and a spirit of resilience amidst challenges.

item.title: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash - News18
item.description:
Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

Date: January 01, 2025

Source: News18

A devastating final photo emerged of the three-year-old boy who was killed in the South Korean plane crash alongside his parents. Kang Ko, his wife Jin Lee Seon and their son were killed when the Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 crashed while attempting an emergency landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The three-year-old boy was on his first trip abroad to celebrate Christmas with his family.
  • Kang Ko worked in public relations for the Kia Tigers baseball team.
  • Of the 181 people onboard, only two flight attendants survived the plane crash.
  • Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash.
“He was so good at his job that everyone on our company’s baseball broadcasting team liked him. We waited until the end for news of a miraculous return... In the end, he never returned. Not even his family.” - Sports broadcaster Jung Woo-young

This tragic event highlights the fragility of life and the overwhelming impact of such incidents on families and communities.

item.title: Abu Dhabi welcomes 2025 with fireworks and drone show, setting Guinness world records - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Abu Dhabi dazzled the world with a 50-minute fireworks display and a 6,000-drone show, breaking six Guinness World Records to mark the New Year.

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Abu Dhabi dazzled the world with an unforgettable New Year’s Eve celebration, hosting the largest fireworks display at the Sheikh Zayed Festival in Al Wathba. The breathtaking spectacle, which lasted 50 minutes, captivated audiences and set six new Guinness World Records.

  • The 6,000-drone show illuminated the skies for over 20 minutes, forming intricate aerial art.
  • Fireworks displays occurred every hour from 6 p.m. leading to a stunning midnight showcase.
  • Major locations in Abu Dhabi, including Yas Island and the Corniche, participated in the celebrations.
  • In 2023, the festival set three Guinness World Records for its previous fireworks display.
  • The Sheikh Zayed Festival features a variety of attractions, including laser shows and cultural performances.
"This year's event reflects Abu Dhabi’s commitment to outshining its previous records."

The celebrations demonstrated Abu Dhabi's vibrant culture and its aim to create memorable experiences, marking a remarkable start to the new year.

item.title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: PM Modi extends New Year’s greetings, says ‘may this year bring new opportunities, success’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: January 1, 2025 - Source: The Indian Express

As India welcomed 2025, President Droupadi Murmu greet the citizens, urging a collective commitment towards a brighter, inclusive, and sustainable future. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed hopes for new opportunities in the upcoming year.

  • Global celebrations included fireworks in major cities like Sydney, London, and Rio De Janeiro.
  • New York's iconic Ball Drop featured performances from various artists such as Kesha and The Jonas Brothers.
  • In India, police enforced measures to ensure safety during celebrations, including bans on firecrackers and deployment in major cities.
“Let us renew our commitment to work together for a brighter, more inclusive and sustainable future.” - President Droupadi Murmu

The New Year celebrations are marked by joy, music, and family gatherings, ushering in a year full of hope and new possibilities.
